newsitem.title: USA: CBS TV president resigns in huff - report.
newsitem.headline: CBS TV president resigns in huff - report.

text.p: Peter Lund, the president of the CBS television network has resigned, the New York Times said.
In Friday's edition, the Times quoted unnamed high-level executives as saying Lund resigned after he was informed he would no longer oversee the network's television-stations division.

Michael Jordan, the chief executive of CBS and its parent company, Westinghouse Electric Corp, had told Lund that the company was to be reorganized to put the 14 CBS stations under the direction of Mel Karmazin, chief executive of CBS radio, the Times said.
Lund, who has been president of CBS since 1994, then told Jordan he was resigning, it said.

"I just didn't agree with the proposed new structure," Lund told the Times. "This is not about Mel -- I think Mel will do a terrific job. But this is a serious difference of opinion on how the responsibilities should be divided."
